    Yota.back! — Function.

    Backpropagate through the tape, record derivatives as new operations

    Yota.check_deriv_sizes — Function.

    For each input that has a derivative on this tape check if the derivative has the same size as the input.

    Yota.deriv_expr — Function.

    Rewrite single call expression into its derivative. Example:

    deriv_expr(:(sin(x)), [Float64], 1)
# ==> :((cos(x) * ds))

    Yota.grad — Function.

    Find gradient of f w.r.t. its arguments. Example:

    val, g = grad(sum, rand(3))

    where:

    • val is the value of f at this point
    • g::GradResult is a collection of gradients

    GradResult is indexed by argument index and contains gradients in a format most suitable for that argument, namely:

    • for arrays: arrays of the same type and size
    • for reals: reals
    • for mutable structs: dictionary of {(:field, :path) => value} pairs.

    All gradients can be applied to original variables using update!() function.

    Yota.guess_device

    Yota.is_cuarray — Function.

    Check if the argument is of type CuArray. Doesn't require CuArrays.jl to be loaded

    Yota.record! — Function.

    Record a new operation (defined by its type and arguments for constructor) to a tape and return ID of this new op.

    Yota.record_expr! — Function.

    Parse a complex call expression and record corresponding operations to a tape.

    Optionally takes substitution table (st parameter) to replace known symbols with provided values.

    Keyword params:

    • st::Dict - substitution table, used to replace symbols in ex with tape op ids
    • bcast::Bool - replace all function calls with corresponding broadcasting
    Yota.recover_broadcast — Function.

    Recover broadcast operation from Broadcast.broadcasted and Broadcast.materialize

    Yota.replace_in_args! — Function.

    Replace all call arguments according to the provided dict

    Yota.resolve_functions_and_types!
    Yota.resolve_old_broadcast
    Yota.rewrite_mul — Function.

    Rewrite :(Z = X * Y) into :(mul!(Z, X, Y)), but only if X and Y are arrays

    Yota.trace — Function.

    Trace function execution using provided arguments. Returns calculated value and a tape.

    foo(x) = 2.0x + 1.0
val, tape = trace(foo, 4.0)
